Introductory Paragraphs

Responsive Web Design Classes from Kent State University.

Paragraphs

In Kent State University's first-ever Responsive Web Design course, you will learn the fundamental principles for developing standards-based web sites from a mobile-first and content-first perspective. We will explore each aspect of an agile-inspired process, during which you’ll learn each step of what it takes to build a responsive website and ensure its functionality for users in terms of both usability and performance.

  • Browser Testing

  • Paired and Team Coding
  • Mobile-First Design

30

Week 14 Preview - Finalizing Prototypes and Pattern Library + Special Guest Speaker

We’re nearly finished with the semester! In the next class, we’ll work on finalizing your HTML/CSS Prototypes, prepare your pattern libraries and have a special guest.

November
24

Class Tonight + No Office Hours on Nov. 24

All - just a reminder that we’ll be conducting usability testing during class today, as well as continuing to work on the prototype projects. I’ll also give a short lecture on style guides and content management systems.
